topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54165e38636872562f900000#post_54165e38636872562f900000
Even some atheists have some moral conscience that have roots to the Bible, especially in the western world. Whether they or not they are aware of it or even want to admit it. I mean, it's just that ingrained in the mindset of society.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54165fc5636872213bab0000#post_54165fc5636872213bab0000
I will politely disagree. Moral conscience has its roots in humanity, not in any one book or the words we put around.

For instance, arguably the greatest moral philosophy in the Bible and certainly one of the more quotable lines of Jesus "Do unto others as you would have them do unto you" can be found with little variation across numerous faiths all over the world.

And frankly I don't believe that even most decent Christians derive their morals from the Bible, however I will continue that train of thought in the Religion General thread.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541661dc6368725ee9650100#post_541661dc6368725ee9650100
even if christianity was the source of these morals
they are such common agreed upon things now, that removing religion now, shouldn't remove these morals
unless certain do only follow those morals for religious reasons
[spoiler]i no speak good[/spoiler]

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541661dc6368725ee9650100#post_541661dc6368725ee9650100
Yeah, I guess.
A lot of Confucian moral philosophies are eeriely similar to Abrahamic philosophies.

Laws didn't just simply come out of nowhere. Humans, to a degree, naturally have some sense of moral restraints when being around others of their own kind. Religions and customs that often influence civil laws are only certain people's interpretations of morality.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
removing religion wont affect humanity is my opinion.

people dont need a book to know what is moral and what isnt.

and people who do bad things are just using the bible as a scapegoat, they would do bad things regardless.


but placebo effect can be a powerfull thing, and it can drive a manÂ´s will against all odds and make him succeed if he believes there is something beyond.

so at the end religion is a natural thing to be born, just like language, its bound to happen no matter what we do.
